1.text: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, And loving favour rather than silver and gold.

2.text: The rich and the poor meet together—The LORD is the maker of them all.

3.text: A prudent man seeth the evil, and hideth himself; But the thoughtless pass on, and are punished.

4.text: The reward of humility is the fear of the LORD, Even riches, and honour, and life.

5.text: Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward; He that keepeth his soul holdeth himself far from them.

6.text: Train up a child in the way he should go, And even when he is old, he will not depart from it.

7.text: The rich ruleth over the poor, And the borrower is servant to the lender.

8.text: He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity; And the rod of his wrath shall fail.

9.text: He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; For he giveth of his bread to the poor.

10.text: Cast out the scorner, and contention will go out; Yea, strife and shame will cease.

11.text: He that loveth pureness of heart, That hath grace in his lips, the king shall be his friend.

12.text: The eyes of the LORD preserve him that hath knowledge, But He overthroweth the words of the faithless man.

13.text: The sluggard saith: ‘There is a lion without; I shall be slain in the streets.’

14.text: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: He that is abhorred of the LORD shall fall therein.

15.text: Foolishness is bound up in the heart of a child; But the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.

16.text: One may oppress the poor, yet will their gain increase; One may give to the rich, yet will want come.

17.text: Incline thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, And apply thy heart unto my knowledge.

18.text: For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; Let them be established altogether upon thy lips.

19.text: That thy trust may be in the LORD, I have made them known to thee this day, even to thee.

20.text: Have not I written unto thee excellent things Of counsels and knowledge;

21.text: That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth, That thou mightest bring back words of truth to them that send thee?

22.text: Rob not the weak, because he is weak, Neither crush the poor in the gate;

23.text: For the LORD will plead their cause, And despoil of life those that despoil them.

24.text: Make no friendship with a man that is given to anger; And with a wrathful man thou shalt not go;

25.text: Lest thou learn his ways, And get a snare to thy soul.

26.text: Be thou not of them that strike hands, Or of them that are sureties for debts;

27.text: If thou hast not wherewith to pay, Why should he take away thy bed from under thee?

28.text: Remove not the ancient landmark, Which thy fathers have set.

29.text: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; He shall not stand before mean men.
